newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila stock index plunges on property fears.
newsitem.headline: Manila stock index plunges on property fears.

text.p: Manila stocks took a dive at the close on Tuesday as concerns over the financial health of Empire East Land Holdings Inc sparked a new wave of selling, traders said.
"The nasty rumours on Empire East exacerbated jitters the Philippines may be the next Thailand," said a foreign broker.
The main index tumbled 2.87 percent, or 84.53 points, to 2,860.45.
Only 10 issues survived the blood letting that hit 141 other issues. Thirty seven remained unchanged.
Mass housing builder Empire East ended down by 29.81 percent, or by 1.55 pesos, at 3.65 while its parent Megaworld Properties & Holdings Inc dropped 29.25 percent, or 1.55 pesos to 3.75.
"Empire East was the leading force that pulled down the market," a foreign brokers who did not want to be named said.
Traders said they expected the market to remain weak tomorrow, with the index seen finding its next support at the 2,800 level.
